title: [Feature flag] Rollout of `ci_remove_userless_ci`
description:
## Summary

This issue is to rollout [the feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363711) on production,
that is currently behind the `ci_remove_userless_ci` feature flag.

<!-- Short description of what the feature is about and link to relevant other issues. -->

## Owners

- Team: Pipeline Execution
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_pipeline_execution`
- Best individual to reach out to: @allison.browne 
- PM: @jheimbuck_gl 

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

An extremely legacy use case of builds being authorized without users is completely blocked. The only time we should see this code path triggered is if 6 year old builds are run.

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

Legit builds could be blocked from accessing git pulls.

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

Sentry errors for GitAccess class

### What can we check for monitoring production after rollouts?

_Consider adding links to check for Sentry errors, Production logs for 5xx, 302s, etc._

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status 03dd18efdfa70c0cff8d13fa1f968787dde33142`
- [x] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set ci_remove_userless_ci true --dev --staging --staging-ref`
- [x] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.
      The best environment to validate the feature in is [staging-canary](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/#staging-canary)
      as this is the first environment deployed to. Note you will need to make sure you are configured to use canary as outlined [here](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/canary-stage/)
      when accessing the staging environment in order to make sure you are testing appropriately.

### Specific rollout on production

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to both production and canary.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status 03dd18efdfa70c0cff8d13fa1f968787dde33142`
- If you're using [project-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab,gitlab-org/gitlab-foss,gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com ci_remove_userless_ci true`
- [x] Verify that the feature works on the specific entries. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Preparation before global rollout

- [x] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/97828) an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com. 

### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be executed in the `#production` slack channel and cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_pipeline_execution`).

- [x] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set ci_remove_userless_ci 50 --actors`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set ci_remove_userless_ci true`
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/97828) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [x] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

**WARNING:** This approach has the downside that it makes it difficult for us to
[clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) the flag.
For example, on-premise users could disable the feature on their GitLab instance. But when you
remove the flag at some point, they suddenly see the feature as enabled and they can't roll it back
to the previous behavior. To avoid this potential breaking change, use this approach only for urgent
matters.

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

You can either [create a follow-up issue for Feature Flag Cleanup](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) or use the checklist below in this same issue.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [x] Create a merge request to remove `ci_remove_userless_ci` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [x] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [x] Ask for review and merge it. 
- [x] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [x] Close [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [x] If not already done, clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete ci_remove_userless_ci --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [x] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set ci_remove_userless_ci false
```

title: Add a call-to-action to the version indicator
description:
## Overview

Per [Slack discussion](https://gitlab.slack.com/archives/CLW71KM96/p1658329707743669), there was feedback on adding a call-to-action on click the indicator.

![image](/uploads/17fdf5b67306d8056541a80221e6f9ce/image.png)

Since the current badge only behaves as an indicator without giving guidance on action, it makes sense to connect to **how to upgrade the instance.**

## Proposal

- Provide a link to the SSOT for users for immediate action.
 - Link: `https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/update/`

### Details

There are three badges across the UI and we'd like to add CTA for three areas.
And then we could consider implementing and tracking the behavior using the Snowplow.

| Dropdown | Admin dashboard  | Help docs(`/help`) |
| ------ | ------ | ------ |
| ![dropdown](/uploads/f2c41d84a01f5ee936e7e0dea73bd46d/dropdown.png) | ![admin-dashboard](/uploads/2bb32cc0c5200a18e340190af4ecfdc8/admin-dashboard.png) | ![help-docs](/uploads/f6c02f901904465dfe2b8b0d7820cddf/help-docs.png) |

- In the dropdown: users could click the dropdown option
- In the admin dashboard and the help page: users could click the [actionable badges](https://gitlab-org.gitlab.io/gitlab-ui/?path=/docs/base-badge--actionable)
  - All points lead users to `https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/update/` for the easier upgrade.

title: Frontend: Improve design of CI/CD Variables Modal
description:
<!-- This template is a great use for issues that are feature::additions or technical tasks for larger issues.-->

## Problem

The Modal that pops up when you are updating CI/CD variables in GitLab is incredibly short. So if you have a list of variables that is greater that 10 lines, the textarea is for the Value field is very very short.

Often times I need to check multiple variables and scrolling can be quite annoying and I will lose my place in the value list.

## Proposal  

Make the text area scale with input for a up to 10 rows. Beyond the 10 rows the input will scroll.

title: Update agentk to support cloud provider authn in Kubernetes 1.25 libraries
description:
Initially reported here https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/342696#note_1031217943

In agentk we [install authn plugins](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cluster-integration/gitlab-agent/-/blob/e477f9401a9cd541c5f49ff6b417365d050feb68/cmd/agentk/main.go#L7-8) for cloud providers so that it can authn when deployed to such clusters. In Kubernetes 1.25 there will be changes to the plugins - no plugin code will be bundled. See: https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/containers-kubernetes/kubectl-auth-changes-in-gke.

At the moment agentk uses `1.24.2` libraries with all the plugins bundles (compiled into the binary). When deployed to a cluster of any version, agentk will use the plugins it has. Because of that, this change will not break existing or future users of agentk.

Before updating to `1.25` or newer libraries we need to investigate what we need to do to be compatible with all Kubernetes versions we support at that moment.

Relevant links in random order:

- https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/tree/master/keps/sig-auth/541-external-credential-providers
- https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/110013
- https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/103498
- https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/102181
- https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/skaffold/issues/7059

epic.title: Add support for Kubernetes version 1.25

title: VSA "Time to complete stage" chart displays no data point when data is 0
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

VSA "Stage time" chart doesn't draw any point when data for given day is rounded to zero. Example:

![image](/uploads/c6ff64529563f862ed9fd06ff319d031/image.png)

while the API call returns `26596.320536303272` seconds for that day which is roughly 0.3 days. I guess the chart rounds it down to 0 and doesn't display 0s.

### Example Project

https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/analytics/value_stream_analytics?created_after=2022-06-20&created_before=2022-07-19&value_stream_id=1341&stage_id=4187&sort=end_event&direction=desc&page=1

<!-- If possible, please create an example project here on GitLab.com that exhibits the problematic 
behavior, and link to it here in the bug report. If you are using an older version of GitLab, this 
will also determine whether the bug is fixed in a more recent version. -->

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Dots with `0` as value should be rendered. Without it chart looks significantly different from real chart.
![image](/uploads/64130539b7a8cc9bdb441be61a77de00/image.png)

<!-- Describe what you should see instead. -->

### Possible fixes

1. Change display unit from days to at least hours to provide better vision.
2. Display dots with `0` as value.

<!-- If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem. -->

/cc @ekigbo @hsnir1

description:
<!---
Please read this!

filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

Graphs show that average time to complete "Plan" stage for issues created on June 23, 2022 is 128 days. So on average this stage is finished around end of October 2022 which can't happen because today is July 19 2022.

The API returns quite big number:

title: Publish Gemnasium images every day
description:
### Problem to solve

Today the official Docker images for Gemnasium are built and published twice a week via scheduled pipelines.
Unless project maintainers trigger these pipelines manually, or release a new version,
it takes up to 3 days between the moment when the Linux distribution gets a security patch,
and the moment when this patch lands in the Docker images of Gemnasium.

### Proposal

Build and re-publish the official Docker images of Gemnasium every day, or whenever a MR is merged into the default branch.

We can either:
- set `PUBLISH_IMAGES` to `true` at the project level, either in the project settings or in the CI config file
- change the frequency of the existing scheduled pipeline

### Further details

The `gemnasium` project has a biweekly scheduled pipeline where `PUBLISH_IMAGES` is set.

A pipeline for the default branch, and where `PUBLISH_IMAGES` is set, builds and pushes the Docker images for the MAJOR, MINOR, and PATCH version of the latest version found in the CHANGELOG.

/cc @brytannia @ngeorge1 @gonzoyumo

title: Merge details no longer shows "# commits behind"
description:
### Summary

It is currently possible to merge into target branch without the knowledge, that it is behind and/or ahead of the target.

### Steps to reproduce

- Create a MR
- Add changes or files
- Let a Pipeline Run or Fail

### What is the current *bug* behavior?
MR is marked ready without the merge button, but is showing the commits behind information.
![image](/uploads/56380a3082b19e91758635a5504ab675/image.png)

MR is marked ready with the merge button, but the MR is 100+ commits behind without showing it.
![image](/uploads/732bd5721b3c7276e9bf70b3efebffa4/image.png)

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- The ready status should only be shown if the merge button is shown
- Behind and Ahead target branch should always be shown if it is not 0.

### Details of package version
Gitlab Omnibus 15.1.2

### Proposal

Add `Commits behind...` info to widget:

```
[x] Delete source branch   [ ] Edit commit message

The source branch is 59 commits behind the target branch ‚Ä¢ 2 commits and 1 merge commit will be added to master

[Merge]
```

title: When a user is mentioned in the description of a Task, a To Do is not created
description:
## Problem

> A user can be tagged in the description of a Task, but they do not receive a notification. This is counter to the patterns in GitLab and will be confusing. [reference](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363613#note_1029866820)

## Proposal

- When a user is mentioned in a description (or title), they should receive a notification and todo. 
- The same business rules currently in effect for issues apply to Tasks (i.e. correct permissions to see todo, etc.)
- If a task is deleted, it should also delete all of the todos associated with the task and correctly update the todo counter.

description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.

### Summary

On a local gitlab instance, when I go to my account settings, to the email addresses, it says "Linked emails (3)" and then lists only 2 emails.

Here on gitlab.com, it says "Linked emails (2)" and then lists only 1 email.

I am not sure how I got both my accounts into that state, but I don't remember doing anything strange with me email addresses.

title: UI makes it seem like unregistered user could edit task title and status
description:
## Problem

When an unregistered user visits a task, they can still enter the input field for the title and the dropdown for the status, making it look like they could edit these aspects. The "Edit" button for the description is not there, so I don't assume this inconsistency is intentional.
| Title | Status | Response |
|-------|--------|----------|
| ![image](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/b70139be364e742d0a00329be1dad684/image.png) | ![image](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/aa7d9a43c22b89c32c2f53ff5038523a/image.png) | ![image](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/680e9c4c52216ae53b5bd0500127d58e/image.png) |

## Proposal

These items should be displayed without any interactivity when the user cannot edit. Essentially the default state, with no hover, no active state. This will be true of *all widgets* on *all work items* and I believe we're already implementing checks for this on weight, assignees, etc.

title: Improve GitLab migration logs
description:
In the past, some improvements were done in the GitLab Migration logs, but we still can make it better since it's the best tool we have to debug problems.

Proposed improvements

- [x] Add a text message key to all logs - It's important to have a message because it explains what the log is about and can be used as a filter (!100734)
- [x] Use the same attribute name to all logs - Attribute names aren't consistent. For example sometimes `bulk_import_entity_id` is used and sometimes `entity_id` (!100307 )
- [x] All the logs should include the `bulk_import_id` key - This attribute can be used to filter all logs for a specific import (!100611)
- ~~[ ] Log the size of the group/project and source version at the beginning of the process (Not sure if it's possible~~)
- [x] Log the source version (e.g 14.2) ~~and GitLab version (ee foss)~~ at the beginning of the process (!100917 )
- [x] Add stack trace to the error logs  - This will allow us to detect exactly where the error happened (!100917 )
- [x] Include the key "importer: gitlab_migration" to all logs - This attribute will allow us to filter only by GitLab migration logs (!100734)
- [x] Log the imported project URL as proposed in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/375776 (!100917 )
- [x] Create follow-up issue once all tasks here are complete to implement creating a logger similar to the [GitHub::Logger](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/dd1e70d3676891025534dc4a1e89ca9383178fe7/lib/gitlab/github_import/logger.rb#L3-11). We could set as many universal bulk_import log attributes as possible in this new logger (eg `importer`), then change BulkImport to use it. (#378468)

title: Add support for Security Report Schema 15-0-0 to Gemnasium
description:
### Proposal

Update [Gemnasium](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium/) so that it can generate reports that validate the Security Report Schema `15-0-0` when it's configured to so.
To maintain backward compatibility, it can still generate reports that validate `14-0-4`, and this is what it does by default.

A new CI variable is introduced so that we can select the MODEL of the Security Report Schema, and select between `14` and `15`.
The variable defaults to `14`.
A warning is raised when the selected version isn't supported.

TBD: Name of the new CI variable.

### Further details

Gemnasium users the `report` library to generate reports. Today, it generates reports in version `14-0-4`. See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/report/-/blob/v3.12.2/version.go#L16

#368140 updates the `report` library so that it can also generate reports in version `15-0-0` without loosing the ability to generate reports in version `14-0-4`.

To generate a report in version `15-0-0`, the following struct fields should not be set:

- `Vulnerability.Scanner`
- `Vulnerability.Category`
- `Vulnerability.CompareKey`
- `Ref.CompareKey`

Also, `Report.Version` must be set explicitly when the analyzer generates a version of the report format that's not the default. For instance, if `14.0.4` is still the default, then `Report.Version` must be set in the analyzer when the requested MODEL is `15`.

### Availability & Testing

Add image specs to check that when the variable that controls the MODEL is set to `15`:
- The `version` field of the reports is set to `15.0.0`.
- The reports validate the Security Report Schema `15-0-0`.

The existing job integration tests prove that the Gemansium analyzer uses the model `14` by default.

### Implementation plan

Update the `gemnasium` project:

- Upgrade to the version of `report` that supports both models of the schema. See #368140 
   - The `convert` package needs to be changed b/c `Vulnerability.Scanner` becomes a pointer.
- Add a CLI flag that controls the MODEL of the Security Report Schemas.
   - Add a `Flags` function to `convert`.
   - Add a CLI flag that controls the MODEL.
   - Call `convert.Flags()` when setting up the flags of the `run` command. This needs to be done in the `main` package of all three analyzers: gemnasium, gemnasium-maven, and gemnasium-python.
   - Raise a warning when the selected MODEL isn't supported.
   - Don't set the following fields of `Vulnerability` when the requested MODEL is `15`: `Confidence`, `Scanner`, and `CompareKey`.
   - Set `Report.Version` when the requested MODEL doesn't match the default value.
- Add image specs for when the model is `15`.

title: Add support for Security Report Schema 15-0-0 to report library
description:
### Proposal

Update the [report](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/report) Go library so that the Secure analyzers like Gemnasium can generate reports that validate version `15-0-0` of the Security Report Schemas.

To validate Security Report Schemas `15-0-0`, it should be possible to generate a report that doesn't have these fields:

```
.vulnerabilities[].cve
.vulnerabilities[].scanner
.vulnerabilities[].category
.remediations[].fixes[].cve
```

Learn more about `15-0-0` in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339812+.

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/364828#note_1029513483

### Further details

Version `15-0-0` of the Security Report Schemas is being implemented in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/security-report-schemas/-/merge_requests/100.

Version `15-0-0` removes fields from `.vulnerabilities[]` and `.remediations[]`, but today these fields can't be omitted when generating reports using the `report` library. See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/report/-/blob/v3.12.2/vulnerability_test.go#L296

`Vulnerability.Scanner` needs to be a pointer so that it can be omitted. This is a breaking change for the analyzer projects using the `report` library.

### Implementation plan

- Share with ~"group::static analysis" since the analyzers they maintain also use the `report` library. This can be done in this issue, in the MR, and on Slack.
- Change `Vulnerability.Scanner` to a pointer, and set `omitempty`
- Set `omitempty` for `Vulnerability.Category`
- Set `omitempty` for `Vulnerability.CompareKey`
- Set `omitempty` for `Ref.CompareKey`
- Release new minor version of `report`. This is a transition version, and the major version doesn't change.

/cc @gonzoyumo @theoretick

epic.title: Dependency Scanning uses Security Report Schema 15-0-0

title: [Feature flag] Enable `dast_api_auth_option` feature
description:
## Summary

This issue is to rollout [the feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/350514) on production,
that is currently behind the `dast_api_auth_option` feature flag.

**Important:** This feature flag will be removed when related backend changes are deployed.

## Owners

- Team: ~"group::dynamic analysis" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_secure-dynamic-analysis`
- Best individual to reach out to: @djadmin 
- PM: `@derekferguson` 

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

<!-- Describe the expected outcome when rolling out this feature -->

### When is the feature viable?

<!-- What are the settings we need to configure in order to have this feature viable? -->

<!-- 
Example below:
 
1. Enable service ping collection
   `ApplicationSetting.first.update(usage_ping_enabled: true)`
-->

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

<!-- Should the feature flag be turned off? Any MRs that need to be rolled back? Communication that needs to happen? What are some things you can think of that could go wrong - data loss or broken pages? -->

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

<!-- Which dashboards from https://dashboards.gitlab.net are most relevant? -->
_Consider mentioning checks for 5xx errors or other anomalies like an increase in redirects 
(302 HTTP response status)_

### What can we check for monitoring production after rollouts?

_Consider adding links to check for Sentry errors, Production logs for 5xx, 302s, etc._

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- [ ] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> true --dev --staging --staging-ref`
- [ ] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.
      The best environment to validate the feature in is [staging-canary](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/#staging-canary)
      as this is the first environment deployed to. Note you will need to make sure you are configured to use canary as outlined [here](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/canary-stage/)
      when accessing the staging environment in order to make sure you are testing appropriately.

### Specific rollout on production

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to both production and canary.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- If you're using [project-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab,gitlab-org/gitlab-foss,gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com <feature-flag-name> true`
- If you're using [group-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --group=gitlab-org,gitlab-com <feature-flag-name> true`
- If you're using [user-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --user=<your-username> <feature-flag-name> true`
- [ ] Verify that the feature works on the specific entries. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Preparation before global rollout

- [ ] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [ ] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [ ] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [ ] Announce on [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com. 
- [ ] Ensure that any breaking changes have been announced following the [release post process](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#deprecations-removals-and-breaking-changes) to ensure GitLab customers are aware.
- [ ] Notify `#support_gitlab-com` and your team channel ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)).

### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be executed in the `#production` slack channel and cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_TEAM_NAME`).

- [ ] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> <rollout-percentage> --actors`
  - If the feature flag in code does **NOT** have [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform time-based rollout (**random** rollout).
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> <rollout-percentage> --random`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> true`
- [ ] Announce on [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [ ] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

### (Optional) Release the feature with the feature flag

If you're still unsure whether the feature is [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release)
but want to release it in the current milestone, you can change the default state of the feature flag to be enabled.
To do so, follow these steps:

- [ ] Create a merge request with the following changes. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [ ] Set the `default_enabled` attribute in [the feature flag definition](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-flag-definition-and-validation) to `true`.
    - [ ] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the default-enabling MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [ ] Consider cleaning up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel. Otherwise these settings may override the default enabled.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete <feature-flag-name> --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] Set the next milestone to this rollout issue for scheduling [the flag removal](#release-the-feature).
- [ ] (Optional) You can [create a separate issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) for scheduling the steps below to [Release the feature](#release-the-feature).
    - [ ] Set the title to "[Feature flag] Cleanup `<feature-flag-name>`".
    - [ ] Execute the `/copy_metadata <this-rollout-issue-link>` quick action to copy the labels from this rollout issue.
    - [ ] Link this rollout issue as a related issue.
    - [ ] Close this rollout issue.

**WARNING:** This approach has the downside that it makes it difficult for us to
[clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) the flag.
For example, on-premise users could disable the feature on their GitLab instance. But when you
remove the flag at some point, they suddenly see the feature as enabled and they can't roll it back
to the previous behavior. To avoid this potential breaking change, use this approach only for urgent
matters.

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

You can either [create a follow-up issue for Feature Flag Cleanup](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) or use the checklist below in this same issue.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [ ] Create a merge request to remove `<feature-flag-name>` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [ ] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [ ] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [ ] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] If not already done, clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete <feature-flag-name> --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [ ] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> false
```

title: Fix incorrect attribute documentation in Deployments API
description:
## Problem

The `status` attribute is listed as **not required** for one of the resources in [Deployments API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/deployments.html#create-a-deployment) documentation.

However, when trying to create deployment by sending a request to the resource without passing this attribute, we receive the following error:

```bash
{"error":"status is missing, status does not have a valid value"}
```

This seems to be a documentation error, as the [implementation](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/lib/api/deployments.rb#L85) clearly shows `status` is required.

Additionally, the description for that same attribute have `created` documented as one of the values you could use to filter deployments, but the [implementation](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/lib/api/deployments.rb#L88) does not. This can be confirmed by passing `status=created` in the request, which results in the following error:

```bash
{"error":"status does not have a valid value"}
```

## Proposal

Fix the documentation to ensure:

- `status` is listed as required for this API resource.
- `created` is removed from the list of allowed values in the attribute description.

title: Spike: Refactor and consolidate all "tool" dropdowns to use GraphQL
description:
Consolidate all three scanner tool dropdowns (Project, Group, Instance) to use the same `scanner_filter.vue` component. And migrate the population of the dropdown items to use the GraphQL Vulnerability Scanners Query. | - | Project | Group | Instance | | ------ | ------ | ------ | ------ | | - | ![2022-07-18_at_1.17_PM](/uploads/a98a0fde78534f5f985123441da5f058/2022-07-18_at_1.17_PM.png) | ![2022-07-18_at_1.18_PM](/uploads/32b1932ee53acee7b1968a366e647d45/2022-07-18_at_1.18_PM.png) | ![2022-07-18_at_1.18_PM](/uploads/77946d52af899681495b16e5163c735f/2022-07-18_at_1.18_PM.png) | |Current
_Proposal_| `scanner_filter.vue`
_same_ |`simple_filter.vue`
_`scanner_filter.vue`_|`simple_filter.vue`
_`scanner_filter.vue`_| |Current
_Proposal_ | HAML
_GraphQL_ | Hard coded
_GraphQL_ | Hard coded
_GraphQL_ | Here are the GraphQL Vulnerability Scanners Queries that we should and possibly utilize instead: | Queries | Sample Data | |---------|-------------| | ![image](https://gitlab.com/sming-gitlab/my-gitlab/uploads/cf8932a8f6460d67785bb0b3dc6164b0/image.png) |![image](/uploads/d320ba16c70e3d37154698d78589f53b/image.png)| ## üí™ Why this is important All three scanner tool dropdowns currently use multiple sources to populate the dropdown items. Because it's not a single source, it can easily jeopardize data integrity and make it very difficult to maintain. So if we wanted to make any changes, we would need to make the adjustments in 3 separate areas, which increases the delivery and engineering time üòñ Versus if all 3 were consolidated and using a shared component, any maintenance or feature addition could be made to a just a singular point. This means we can deliver a feature in a shorter amount of time and with more reliability :thumbsup: _optional read_: To better understand the problem with the complication of the current architecture and the importance of this issue, here's how the tool dropdown works ü§ì:
Click to expand ## 1Ô∏è‚É£ How the tool dropdown items are populated There are 3 dropdowns - Project, Group, and Instance. They populate the dropdown items from different sources üòñ ### Instance and Group These two views are using the `simple_filter.vue` component. The dropdown items are populated from hard-coded data üò± ([code](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/dd1e70d3676891025534dc4a1e89ca9383178fe7/ee/app/assets/javascripts/security_dashboard/store/constants.js#L20)). It does not support the display of group data (as that's only available in `scanner_filter.vue` which is only being used by the Project view). ![image](https://gitlab.com/sming-gitlab/my-gitlab/uploads/0a1aab3680e48d3ab1b4604494c2a7b4/image.png) ### Project It uses the `scanner_filter.vue` component (which extends from the `simple_filter.vue`). The dropdown items use the "scanners" injected from the `data-scanners` passed through in HAML's data attribute. Not GraphQL query. [Code](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/7dfbe472015ab104827c636387fc251313a6af61/ee/app/assets/javascripts/security_dashboard/vulnerability_report_init.js#L44) | Introduced in this MR `https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/51696/diffs` Sample data looks like this: ```javascript data-scanners="[ { id: 151, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "DEPENDENCY_SCANNING" }, { id: 155, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, { id: 156, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, { id: 184, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "DEPENDENCY_SCANNING" }, { id: 162, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "API_FUZZING" }, { id: 161, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SECRET_DETECTION" }, { id: 160, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "COVERAGE_FUZZING" }, { id: 157, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, { id: 158, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, { id: 153, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "CLUSTER_IMAGE_SCANNING" }, { id: 152, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "CONTAINER_SCANNING" }, { id: 159, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, { id: 154, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "DAST" }, ]" ``` It supports the display of group data. MR > `https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/49710` ![image](https://gitlab.com/sming-gitlab/my-gitlab/uploads/d76c57c5e3c20e222b4e38ad5e46c8a6/image.png) ## 2Ô∏è‚É£ How the tool dropdown filtering works The filtering happens with a `vulnerabilities` GraphQL query request ``` Group.vulnerabilities Project.vulnerabilities Query.vulnerabilities (Instance) ``` ### Group and Instance The following arguments are used to conduct the filtering: ``` reportType: [] Filter vulnerabilities by report type. ``` | ¬†Group ¬† | ¬†Instance ¬† | |----------|-------------| | ¬†![2022-07-15_at_10.25_PM](https://gitlab.com/sming-gitlab/my-gitlab/uploads/a5118762e97c0e09bfc56e47bd020a6e/2022-07-15_at_10.25_PM.png) | ¬†![2022-07-15_at_10.29_PM](https://gitlab.com/sming-gitlab/my-gitlab/uploads/6120271f6919fe0457499d58ce9c6f44/2022-07-15_at_10.29_PM.png) | ### Project The following arguments are used to conduct the filtering ``` reportType: [] Filter vulnerabilities by report type. scannerId: [] Filter vulnerabilities by scanner ID. ``` Example: ![2022-07-15_at_9.58_PM](https://gitlab.com/sming-gitlab/my-gitlab/uploads/62fd1af4d2f11316c7b102e8d4f76e69/2022-07-15_at_9.58_PM.png) #### Scanner ID The great thing is that we're using GraphQL to do the filtering. However because the project doesn't use GraphQL to populate the dropdown items, the FE need to do some additional manual work. The FE need to update the `id` to a compatible `scanner_id` format to make the GraphQL request. The scanner ID was introduced in this MR > `https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/60556`. Here's the data coming from HAML where we're utilizing the `id`: ``` data-scanner = [ { id: 155, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, // üëà { id: 156, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, // üëà // ... { id: 157, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, // üëà { id: 158, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, // üëà // ... { id: 159, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "SAST" }, // üëà { id: 154, vendor: "GitLab", report_type: "DAST" }, ]; ``` Which will then need to convert it to the compatibility `scannerId` > [Code](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/9b2af2dca725b54412e9d0592371b76336c9f686/ee/app/assets/javascripts/security_dashboard/components/shared/filters/scanner_filter.vue#L84): ``` const scannerIds = [ "gid://gitlab/Vulnerabilities::Scanner/155", "gid://gitlab/Vulnerabilities::Scanner/156", "gid://gitlab/Vulnerabilities::Scanner/157", "gid://gitlab/Vulnerabilities::Scanner/158", "gid://gitlab/Vulnerabilities::Scanner/159", ] ``` This can be resolved if the FE consumes the dropdown data from GraphQL's vulnerability scanner query. No additional data manipulation will be required. ## üïµÔ∏è Finding Verdict Many of the complications can be completely removed if a shared component is used where we populate the data from a single source with Graphql Query.
## üåü Proposal 1. Keep it [DRY](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don%27t_repeat_yourself) by consolidating all three scanner tool dropdowns (Project, Group, Instance) to use the same `scanner_filter.vue` component 2. Update all dropdowns to populate data from a single source of truth with GraphQL query

epic.title: Refactor and consolidate all "tool" dropdowns to use GraphQL

title: NoMethodError: undefined method `to_sym' for nil:NilClass
description:
## Overview

* 2022-07-18 8:00 - @mwoolf noticed higher API error rates.
* Linked to this issue: https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/issues/3373969/  

500 error seems to be caused when using keyset pagination and not including an `order_by` attribute. Example: 

```
GET /api/v4/groups/35/audit_events?per_page=100&pagination=keyset

=> 500 Internal Server Error

GET /api/v4/groups/12875677/audit_events?per_page=100&pagination=keyset&order_by=id

=> 200 OK
```

##

https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/issues/3373969/?referrer=gitlab_plugin

```
NoMethodError: undefined method `to_sym' for nil:NilClass
  lib/gitlab/pagination/keyset/cursor_based_request_context.rb:31:in `order_by'
    { params[:order_by].to_sym => params[:sort]&.to_sym || DEFAULT_SORT_DIRECTION }
  lib/gitlab/pagination/cursor_based_keyset.rb:33:in `order_satisfied?'
    order_by_from_request = cursor_based_request_context.order_by
  lib/gitlab/pagination/cursor_based_keyset.rb:25:in `available?'
    order_satisfied?(relation, cursor_based_request_context)
  lib/api/helpers/pagination_strategies.rb:41:in `keyset_paginator'
    unless availability_checker.available?(request_context, relation)
  lib/api/helpers/pagination_strategies.rb:21:in `paginator'
    return keyset_paginator(relation) if keyset_pagination_enabled?
...
(161 additional frame(s) were not displayed)
```

title: Support base64 encoded passwords via DAST_API_HTTP_PASSWORD_BASE64
description:
To make DAST API the default engine for On-demand API Scanning  the monolith will pass in basic authentication values. These values will be encoded and not sent via plain text, **encoding them ensures that the runner masks the values.**

The API Security engine currently expects:
`DAST_API_HTTP_USERNAME` and `DAST_API_HTTP_PASSWORD`

however the monolith will instead be sending `DAST_API_HTTP_PASSWORD_BASE64`

The API Security engine needs to be updated to accept these as per https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/327070#note_730240965

epic.title: API Scanner for DAST should be separate from DAST

title: Group Migration does not migrate Uploads when object storage is set up
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

<!-- Summarize the bug encountered concisely. -->

The new [Group Migration](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/import/) feature does not migrate `Uploads` (images from epics, comments, etc) when object storage (e.g. GCP Cloud Storage, AWS S3) is set up. This does work when local storage is used.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

<!-- Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output, logs, and code
 as it's tough to read otherwise. -->

This was investigated in an issue on behalf of a customer: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/manage/import/support/-/issues/14 (Internal only)

**Extracted the following section from the investigation from** @rodrigo.tomonari on test group migration onto an instance with Google Cloud Storage as object storage:

> In the `importer.log`, I found the following errors:
> 
> ```
> {"feature_category":"importers","severity":"ERROR","time":"2022-07-15T15:19:36.960Z","correlation_id":"01G8171ZS3YAQ7454R2N1YBXS0","bulk_import_id":22,"bulk_import_entity_id":48,"bulk_import_entity_type":"group_entity","pipeline_class":"BulkImports::Common::Pipelines::UploadsPipeline","pipeline_step":"loader","exception_class":"Errno::EACCES","exception_message":"Permission denied @ dir_s_mkdir - /opt/gitlab/embedded/service/gitlab-rails/public/namespace"}
> {"feature_category":"importers","severity":"ERROR","time":"2022-07-15T15:19:37.003Z","correlation_id":"01G8171ZS3YAQ7454R2N1YBXS0","bulk_import_id":22,"bulk_import_entity_id":48,"bulk_import_entity_type":"group_entity","pipeline_class":"BulkImports::Common::Pipelines::UploadsPipeline","pipeline_step":"loader","exception_class":"Errno::EACCES","exception_message":"Permission denied @ dir_s_mkdir - /opt/gitlab/embedded/service/gitlab-rails/public/namespace"}
> ```
> 
> The last two are related to the missing images as they occurred in the [BulkImports::Common::Pipelines::UploadsPipeline](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/dd1e70d3676891025534dc4a1e89ca9383178fe7/lib/bulk_imports/common/pipelines/uploads_pipeline.rb#L6) more specific in the load phase of the ETL steps.
> 
> For context, the pipeline works by downloading an archive file containing all uploads files from the source instance, extracting the archive file in a temporary folder, creating the uploads records, and uploading the files to the object-store.
> 
> I checked the `uploads.tar` and it was succesfully created in the source instance, and the target instance downloaded the file and extracted it.
> 
> The problem occurred in the last step when the upload record is created and uploaded to object-store. According to the error message, the server tried to access the folder `/opt/gitlab/embedded/service/gitlab-rails/public/namespace`
> 
> I checked the server and turns out the `namespace` folder doesn't exist.
> 
>![image](/uploads/9db93443d91ef3f62450dd08de56543e/image.png)
> 
> So probably the issue is that the folder path is incorrect or the `namespace` folder needs to be created in the server.

epic.title: üêû GitLab Migration bugs

title: [Feature flag] Enable Auditor Access to Group Runners
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## Summary

This issue is to rollout [the feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/357328) on production,
that is currently behind the `auditor_group_runner_access` feature flag.

<!-- Short description of what the feature is about and link to relevant other issues. -->

## Owners

- Team: ~"group::pipeline execution"  
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_pipeline-execution`
- Best individual to reach out to: @kballon 
- PM: @jheimbuck_gl 

## Stakeholders

<!--
Are there any other stages or teams involved that need to be kept in the loop?

- Name of a PM
- The Support Team
- The Delivery Team
-->

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

<!-- Describe the expected outcome when rolling out this feature -->

When this feature is rolled out and the feature flag is enabled, an auditor user should have read only access runners from the group CI/CD view.

### When is the feature viable?

<!-- What are the settings we need to configure in order to have this feature viable? -->

<!-- 
Example below:
 
1. Enable service ping collection
   `ApplicationSetting.first.update(usage_ping_enabled: true)`
-->

N/A

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

<!-- Should the feature flag be turned off? Any MRs that need to be rolled back? Communication that needs to happen? What are some things you can think of that could go wrong - data loss or broken pages? -->

N/A

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

<!-- Which dashboards from https://dashboards.gitlab.net are most relevant? -->

Consider looking out for 4xx errors for *-auditor@gitlab.com accounts.

### What can we check for monitoring production after rollouts?

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status f238b358e85cd396d506c1d72ad0121f36f94c09`
- [x] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set auditor_group_runner_access true --dev --staging --staging-ref`

### Specific rollout on production

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to both production and canary.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- If you're using [project-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab,gitlab-org/gitlab-foss,gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com auditor_group_runner_access true`


### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be executed in the `#production` slack channel and cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_TEAM_NAME`).


- [x] `/chatops run feature set auditor_group_runner_access true`
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/357328) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [x] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

You can either [create a follow-up issue for Feature Flag Cleanup](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) or use the checklist below in this same issue.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [x] Create a merge request to remove `auditor_group_runner_access` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [x] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [x] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [x] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [x] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/357328) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [x] If not already done, clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status faae7b37e9c45cb2835f427ebb856f10a4300ca5`
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete auditor_group_runner_access --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [x] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set auditor_group_runner_access false
```

title: UX Theme: Flexible scan result policy options
description:
## UX Theme 

<!-- ### Theme statement. The combination of the beneficiary and need. (For instance; Reduce the effort for security teams to identify and escalate business-critical risks) --> 

### Flexible scan result policy options

----

### Beneficiary 

<!-- Who benefits from this theme? --> 

- ~"Persona: Security Analyst"

#### Need & JTBD
<!-- What are the JTBD and needs related to this beneficiary/theme--> 

- **JTBD:** As an application security engineer, I need to be able to configure approval policies that align with my organization's requirements so that I can avoid blocking approvals unnecessarily.

<!-- What is the business objective that will result from delivering this theme? These could be Sales rate / conversion rate, Success rate / completion rate, Traffic / visitor count, Engagement, or other measurable metrics.--> 

Drive Ultimate revenue by expanding the number of organizations that will be able to use Scan Result policies.

### Confidence

title: MR Merge Widget new Framework: Update merged, closed and ready to merge states
description:
As a follow-up to changes made to the **<abbr title="merge request">MR</abbr> merge widget** in &5589+, we need to adapt it to the [new framework design guidelines](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports).

**[:frame_photo: Design specs in Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/omvNuR8nn90V8hjVN78OQO/Adapt-MR-merge-widget-to-framework-%23347128?node-id=845%3A1298)**

### Summary of the changes

1. The `merged` and `closed` states have a unique style:
   1. Their background color is `blue-50` or `red-50` respectively.
   1. The background color of the details section is white.
1. The `ready to merge` state contents are responsive:
   1. On `768px +` breakpoints, the checkboxes are **inline** and all items have `16px` spacing between them.
   1. On `<768px` breakpoints, the checkboxes are **stacked** and all items have `8px` spacing between them.


(Please beware of the dark mode of GitLab. Please take it for a spin.)

![Mockups](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/uploads/18b1677eb9075feefc0c80c53801874a/image.png)

See the epic for more context

epic.title: Adapt MR merge widget to new framework

title: MR Merge Widget new Framework: Update details section
description:
As a follow-up to changes made to the **<abbr title="merge request">MR</abbr> merge widget** in &5589+, we need to adapt it to the [new framework design guidelines](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports).

**[:frame_photo: Design specs in Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/omvNuR8nn90V8hjVN78OQO/Adapt-MR-merge-widget-to-framework-%23347128?node-id=845%3A1298)**

### Summary of the changes

1. Details section can now be auto-collapsed:
   1. In the `ready to merge` state, details are always expanded on all viewports and cannot be collapsed.
   1. In all other states:
      1. On `768px +` breakpoints, details are always expanded and cannot be collapsed.
      1. On `<768px` breakpoints, details are collapsed by default and can be expanded using the [expand/collapse button](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#actions).
1. Details section has different text styles:
   1. The `Merge details` heading is only shown in the `merge blocked` states.
   1. The details text uses a smaller font-size and some items are bolded.
1. Details section padding is responsive:
   1. On `768px +` breakpoints, the padding is `16px` top, bottom, and right.
   1. On `<768px` breakpoints, the padding is `8px` top, bottom, and right.
1. All links are now underlined.

![Mockups](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/uploads/18b1677eb9075feefc0c80c53801874a/image.png)

See the epic for more context

epic.title: Adapt MR merge widget to new framework

title: MR Merge Widget new Framework: Update Actions style and alignment
description:
As a follow-up to changes made to the **<abbr title="merge request">MR</abbr> merge widget** in &5589+, we need to adapt it to the [new framework design guidelines](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports).

**[:frame_photo: Design specs in Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/omvNuR8nn90V8hjVN78OQO/Adapt-MR-merge-widget-to-framework-%23347128?node-id=845%3A1298)**

### Summary of the changes

1. [Actions](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#actions) have a different alignment:
   1. On `768px +` breakpoints, actions are right-aligned.
   1. On `<768px` breakpoints, actions are grouped into an options dropdown.
      1. An exception to this are the `merge blocked` states, where actions are always visible. On `<768px` breakpoints, actions are left-aligned, below the subject line, ordered from most to least important (top-down).
1. [Actions](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#actions) have a different style:
   1. In the `merge blocked` states, the most important action uses the [button](https://design.gitlab.com/components/button) primary confirm variant, other actions use the secondary confirm variant.
   1. In all other states, actions use the [button](https://design.gitlab.com/components/button) tertiary confirm variant.


![Mockups](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/uploads/18b1677eb9075feefc0c80c53801874a/image.png)

See the epic for more context

title: Error when removing user's SCIM ID via API
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Group owner gets an error mentioning they aren't part of the group when trying to delete SCIM ID via SCIM API.

### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Describe how one can reproduce the issue - this is very important. Please use an ordered list. -->

### Example Project

<!-- If possible, please create an example project here on GitLab.com that exhibits the problematic 
behavior, and link to it here in the bug report. If you are using an older version of GitLab, this 
will also determine whether the bug is fixed in a more recent version. -->

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

<!-- Describe what actually happens. -->

User was deployed  via SCIM but with the wrong email address (Azure related). Owner wants to redeploy the user with the correct email address but they're unable to do do because they cannot delete the SCIM ID via SCIM API. SCIM ID seems to be already deleted on their end because no identities are shown for the user via Admin.

They get the error:

```
{"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"detail":"Could not remove [user] from [group]. User is not a group member.","status":412}
```

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

<!-- Describe what you should see instead. -->

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

<!-- Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output, logs, and code
 as it's tough to read otherwise. -->

### Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com, GitLab Enterprise Edition 15.3.0-pre 0d272cb0dfd

### Possible fixes

Allow SCIM token tied to group that provisioned the SCIM identity to delete it even if user is no longer a member of the group.

## Possible workaround

Use rails console to find the SCIM identity, then destroy it using `.destroy!`.

Note: This will not change anything about the state of the user account, such as memberships, so this acts differently than deprovisioning.

title: Rename `task` (markdown checklist item) to `check list` in various places throughout the UI
description:
## Problem - We are making `Tasks` a first-class work item type. - This name collides with markdown checklist items, which are also called tasks. ## Proposal Throughout the UI, rename references to markdown checklist tasks to `checklist` (singular checklist which contains many items) and `checklist item` (singular item within a `checklist`) Locations: - [ ] System notes - [ ] Issue row within issue lists - [ ] Issue header (currently reads `x of x tasks completed`) - [ ] Editor (`Add a task list`) | Context | Current | New | | ---- | ---- | ---- | | System Notes | marked the task [name] as completed | marked the checklist item [name] as completed | | Issue list | 0 of 3 tasks completed
(hidden at small size) | 0 of 3 checklist items completed
(hidden at small size) | | Issue header | 0 of 3 tasks completed
0 of 3 tasks (at small sizes) | 0 of 3 checklist items completed
0 of 3 checklist items (at small sizes) | | Editor | Add a task list | Add a checklist |

title: Restart hard-failed mirrors when a subscription is renewed
description:
* Suggested in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/92422#note_1028030701
* Follow-up for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/216783

### Problem

We mark existing pull mirrors as hard-failed when a project is missing the license. But if the license is renewed, pull mirrors are not restarted. Users need to manually request an update one by one. 

### Proposal

Re-enable the existing pull mirroring when a client renews the subscription. 


### Workarounds

1. https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/repository/mirror/pull.html#fix-hard-failures-when-mirroring
2. Send POST request to force update endpoint for each affected project 
   ```
   POST http://gitlab.com/<project-path>/-/mirror/update_now
   ```

epic.title: Pull Mirroring Improvements

title: Enforce that a Member can only be associated with Role if access_level matches
description:
### Background

The ~"group::authentication and authorization" team has been working towards enabling custom roles and permissions in GitLab. We started with a technical discovery, and from that, we had the following outcome:

1. create a new model `Role` with a 2 columns for now: `base_access_level`, `download_code`. Add association via `Member#role_id` (weight: `2`)
1. enforce that a `Member` can only be associated with `Role` if `access_level` matches (weight: `2`)
1. enforce `Member#access_level` cannot be changed if associated with a custom role (weight: `2`)
1. create UI to edit the Role (weight: `5`) / or just API as the description suggests (weight: `3`)
1. edit `ProjectPolicy`: depending on the feature flag `download_code` should use the existing logic or evaluate it based on the `Role` associated with the user in that group hierarchy (weight: `3`)
1. evaluate performance (we might want to involve ~"group::scalability") and define next steps based on that

These tasks will allow us to enable us to evaluate performance constraints. This feature is not user facing.

### Requirements

This is Second step based on the [technical discovery](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/352891#note_993031741):

> enforce that a `Member` can only be associated with `Role` if `access_level` matches

epic.title: Customizable roles MVC - Technical Performance

title: Update style on the cluster creation page
description:
This issue is a follow-up from gitlab-org/gitlab!91526+ and addresses the following comment from `@dmishunov`:

> **UX issue:** with this class change, we reduce the overall width of the container. Instead of 2*50% = 100%, now we have 3*30%=90% width on the container:
> 
> ![Screenshot_2022-07-04_at_10.57.53](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/8ebd0cd9f797116049a3690ac0dcfc00/Screenshot_2022-07-04_at_10.57.53.png)
> 
> This is not too critical, however, this should be addressed as a follow-up at least. My thought is ‚Äî we have to add something like `gl-flex-basis-third` utility somewhere in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ui/-/blob/main/src/scss/utility-mixins/flex.scss#L178-L184 for `gitlab-ui` package and then update this implementation with `gl-flex-basis-third` instead of `gl-w-30p`.

We ended up adding a combination of classes `gl-flex-basis-0`, `gl-flex-grow-1`, and `gl-min-w-0` to achieve similar result. We will need to update it to use `gl-flex-basis-third` once the new class is available.

The MR to add `gl-flex-basis-third` into GitLab UI: gitlab-org/gitlab-ui!2936

title: UX: Container Registry storage visibility - size value clarification
description:
UX issue for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/366215+

## Summary

We need to provide clarity around the size value for Container Registry storage on both the project and namespace level.


### Namespace usage quotas

On the namespace level, the Container Registry storage in the project list should have a note with the following text:

> This project-level storage statistic does not include savings for site-wide deduplication and is not used to calculate total namespace storage.


![Screenshot_2022-07-15_at_09.45.12](/uploads/7a7ba67767f137807f26846f0dd82723/Screenshot_2022-07-15_at_09.45.12.png)



### Project usage quotas

On the project level, the Container Registry storage type should have a note with the following text:

> The project-level storage statistics for the Container Registry are directional only and do not include savings for instance-wide deduplication.

title: Rename confidential column in notes tables
description:
As part of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363801+ we need to a migration to change column name to `internal` and do required changes to model validations and error handling. 

In this phase, we could override `confidential` to act as an alias of `internal` so we do not break services. We should also update our model validations and error handling.

Also to be considered, there is an index on the `notes.confidential` column:

```sql
CREATE INDEX index_notes_on_id_where_confidential ON notes USING btree (id) WHERE (confidential = true);
```

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363801#note_1025497824 for more context.

title: Deprecate API fields using confidential notes
description:
As part of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363801+ we need to complete the following tasks

- [ ] We do expose and accept confidential parameter to create notes on REST API https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a0e7625d059da069f47af514b41fd66c50dca260/lib/api/notes.rb#L76
- [ ] GraphQL also exposes confidential attribute and accepts it as an argument to create confidential notes: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a0e7625d059da069f47af514b41fd66c50dca260/app/graphql/mutations/notes/create/base.rb#L21
- [ ] [NotesController](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/1dff7589a4f04f8e7f9d47bb2122341fc9378fc9/app/controllers/concerns/notes_actions.rb#L220) accepts this parameter to create internal notes on internal API.


We have to deprecate old fields and add the new fields as aliases for these endpoints in the same release, then on the next release frontend can start using the new fields to avoid breaking changes because of [backwards compatibility](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/multi_version_compatibility.html#when-modifying-javascript).

title: Gitlab Migration fails systematically with some data not being migrated.
description:
As reported in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/manage/import/support/-/issues/14#note_1020687989 a customer reported that during the GitLab migration, the import process crashes almost systematically after a while with half of the missing data. They also mentioned that in this case they don't know what has been migrated or not.

Below are some details from the customer:

- general group info: 2 epics, 22 issues
- their group structure. [Group_structure.txt](/uploads/b0ca8ad16e749220853874a25ee93b64/Group_structure.txt)
- bulk_import_failures content :

gitlabhq_production=> SELECT * from bulk_import_failures;

id | bulk_import_entity_id |          created_at           |   pipeline_class    |      exception_class      |                                               exception_message                    

                          |    correlation_id_value    | pipeline_step

----+-----------------------+-------------------------------+---------------------+---------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------------+----------------------------+---------------

90 |                   133 | 2022-07-07 14:35:44.841398+00 | ExportRequestWorker | BulkImports::NetworkError | Unsuccessful response 404 from /api/v4/groups/5000/export_relations. Body: {"message

"=>"404 Group Not Found"} | 01G7CHD4PFB254S64WER9056E6 |

(1 row)

### Problem

The problem occurs when the group `path` looks like a number, e.g. `5000`. In this case, GitLab tries to find the group by ID ([See the code](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/24ab79557d84a4906ca5cffbb5fa7ecd1e7faa1a/lib/api/helpers.rb#L134-138)) and not by the path.

### Proposal

Update `BulkImports::ExportRequestWorker` to request export from source using `id` instead of `full_path`. For this we need to do the followin: 

1. Add `source_id` column to `bulk_import_entities` table
2. Update group & project pipelines that fetch initial entity information to store `source_id` in the newly added column (see https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/367915#note_1085195344 for details)
3. Update the export request worker to perform export network request with the stored `source_id`

title: Spike Research: Explore possible POC for VSA Jira-based stages
description:
### Overview

~"group::optimize" [vision](https://about.gitlab.com/direction/manage/value_stream_management/#vision) is to make GitLab the tool of choice for data-driven DevOps organizations. To achieve this one of our goals is to make Value Stream Analytics (VSA) the single source of truth (SSOT) for DevOps Analytics and to allow users to aggregate multiple data records into one VSA.

### Problem to solve

Customers that are using Jira for issue management and GitLab for CI\CD need single source of insight about what's happening within the entire software delivery lifecycle. 

### Assumption 

1. [GitLab SaaS first](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product/product-principles/#saas-first) with [Atlassian cloud](https://www.atlassian.com/migration/assess/why-cloud). 
1. PostgreSQL is a blocker for this integration, and a new datastore is needed - https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/367178+ 
1. Authentication and authorization will be done with API token. 
2. No support for "mixed" stages - start and stop events on API-based stages can be from the API. 
3. No bidirectional integration - data flow is Jira--> GL only. VSA will only visualize the Jira data.
4. Data refresh will be in `near real-time` - updates every 15m.
4. VSA-Jira integration needs to be compatible with other GitLab-Jira integrations.
5. Group-level only.
6. About VSA DORA - we will start with only "Deployment Frequency" and "Lead Time for Changes".
7. "Tasks by Type" chart is out of scope. 



### Reference use cases 

1. Basic flow for [custom VSA stages](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/value_stream_analytics.html#stage) base on [Jira events](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/342780#note_1018483527).
:

   * Task\issue create in JIRA
   * Branch created in GL
   * Merge request is merged in GL
   * Task\issue closed in JIRA

2. Common flow - TBD
3. Advanced flow - TBD 

### Research Goals


1. Outline a possible POC architecture, major steps, and effort estimation for POC the basic flow.
3. Summarize the main gaps in delivering this integration for customers.

### Investigation and clarification questions:


1. Is it possible to use some of the existing [Jira integration](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/integration/jira/) technical design?


- Can we mapped the events using the [Import Jira tool](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/import/jira.html#import-jira-issues-to-gitlab)?
- In the Jira-based stages can we have a link to [view Jira issues](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/integration/jira/issues.html#view-jira-issues) for deep-dive stage performance investigation? 

3. Any other tools from Ecosystem:Integrations](https://about.gitlab.com/direction/ecosystem/integrations/) group that can be relevant to solving this problem?
2. Can we add filtering to the API? `group`, `project`, `label`, `milestone`?
5. What enhancements need to be done for the [VSA stage event schema](https://www.figma.com/file/rZ6ZHRCXRxy0Wb83FECK5q/VSA-API---conceptual-model?node-id=3396%3A634)?
6. For Jira-based stages can we display in the **Work items table** the Jira `issue name`, `create time`, `last event` and `duration`? 
7. Is it possible to calculate all the metrics in the VSA Overview dashboard? - `Lead Time`, `Cycle Time`, `New Issues` and `Deploys`?


### Investigation summary

Proposed drafts can be found [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/367907#note_1039134809)
Impact and gaps can be found

1. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/367907#note_1031135988
2. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/367907#note_1031310282
3. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/367907#note_1032469188

Approach choice for PoC heavily depends on what clients can do and should be driven by client needs. I'd personally vote for "Alternative workflow" because it's more flexible and easier to use for clients but we should be aware that's its more technically challenging both time wise and performance wise.

title: Create Preview alert + messaging for group namespaces impacted by both user and storage limits
description:
# Summary 

**Current Status** https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/367902#note_1067857681 

As part of the GTM for the Free user efficiency effort, we plan to notify namespaces _impacted_ (defined as namespaces that are over the new defined limits) by the new user and storage limits for our free SaaS offering. In-product notifications are planned for namespaces over the new free user limit (owned by Growth) and namespaces over the new storage limits (owned by Utilization). There will be a distinct group of namespaces that are over both the new free user and storage limits. We'd like to create a single in-product notification for this group that communicates the coming limit enforcement for both users and storage and presents preferred CTAs for this unique group of namespaces. 

# Design Scope

Create an in-production notification that communicates to the user that their namespace will be impacted by both user and storage limits that will be enforced starting 2022-10-19. 

Desired outcome: Namespace up-tiers to a paid subscription. 

# Design
![Alert-user-limit.svg](/uploads/599c3f4e151176bfc22a170e5197b7ab/Alert-user-limit.svg)


### [Figma file](https://www.figma.com/file/aH55oeNpaTu7RfqNpY0ifg/User-Limit-Work?node-id=1054%3A25038)


## Copy

* Title: `Usage limits: From {date}, a limit on seats and storage will apply to this group.`

* Body: `From {date}, free private groups will be limited to {X} seats per group, and free private and public groups will be limited to {X} GB namespace storage. Find out more in our {FAQ}. This group, sub-groups, and related projects exceed the storage and seat limits. On {date}, {##} members will lose access to this group. You can reduce storage or upgrade to a paid plan to get more seats and additional storage.`

## CTAs & Links

* Body link: FAQ >> `https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/faq-efficient-free-tier/`
* Primary CTA: `Manage seats and storage` >> link directs to `/group/-/usagequotas `
* Secondary CTA: `Explore paid plans` >> link direct to `/group/-/billings`


# Implementation Details 

* Namespace type: Group namespaces
* Audience: Group owners only
* Display criteria: 
  * Overview and members pages for the parent level namespace, sub group, and any project. Include usage quotas page display as well.
  * Only display to group namespace owners where the namespace is over the user limit (6+ users) AND over the storage limit (5GB). Note fulfillment has logic we can reference for namespaces currently over the storage limit. 
* Display start date: 2022-08-22
* Responsible for development: Growth
* alert variant: info ([see context](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/367902#note_1054455379))
